I don't understand people who think this is NTR. I'm not even gonna go into the whole "women aren't property thing", and instead go into "you can't take what isn't yours". If they're not together at all, they're fair game. It doesn't matter that they have feelings for each other if someone capitalizes on the fact that the first guy is too much of a pussy to do anything with them (instead of the retardation of "I'll help you get with the guy you like", it's simply "I like you, let's do stuff together".) Made even worse by the REJECTION the first guy does (another trope), as if the girl coming onto them ruins the image of their purity and they shun it. It's literally delivering her to the next guy who actually wants to accept what she's willing to give.

All that to say, this shouldn't be NTR, peeps.

Just for people who are asking, "Is this NTR".  This technically counts as NTR in Japan because it is what is "perceived" by the MC.  The word NTR means "to be taken away" which in this case, he perceives that this childhood friend is being taken away.

So although they weren't technically dating, in technical Japanese terms, it still counts as ntr.

Someone could get ntr'd without being in a relationship and someone could get cheated on without being ntr'd, it's based on the whether they're there to witness it and had interest on one of the people.
